text: 330 ml can. Pours a hazy yellow colour with a small foamy head. Aroma of super strong brett notes, earthiness and salt. Flavour of brett, sourness, yeastiness and some bitterness. Alcohol warms a bit. Very weird. Probably infected somehow.

33 cl can. BBE 30.05.2017.
Pours clear golden color with a small head. Aroma is strong farmhouse-y, herbal, yeasty and some earth. Flavor is also funky and farmhouse-y, yeast, subtle spices, malts and lemon. Not quite what I was expecting, interesting bretta-things going on here, not sure if intentionally or not.
4323
33cl can from ales by mail. Appearance is dark gold to orange. Head is medium and white. Medium body. Medium bitterness, light to medium sweetness. Aroma is orange, hops, egg, vegetables.

330ml can from Ales by Mail. Pours golden orange with a thick white head. Aroma of gooseberries, caramely malts, hints of grass and perfume. Taste is sweetish, crisp and perfumy with some caramel, grass, gooseberries and hay. Finish is malty and caramely with some perfumy grassy hoppiness and earthiness. A bit weird.

Can from Alesbymail. Hazy orange with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and rather bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 300816
Can at jamess. Pours hazy orange, nose is sweet toffee, light citrus, taste is dry, bitter, light fruit.

330 ml bottle shared by Werckmeister, thanks!
Amber, hazy body, with a medium, fluffy, off-white head.
Aroma of grapefruit, pine, flowers, fresh herbs, grass, andy.
Taste follows this pretty much.
Light, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes medium bitter, dry, zesty, piney, floral, grassy, a bit malty.

Very nice. Pretty above average Lager, hoppy and dry, while easy and fresh. Lovely floral and piney notes. If all Lagers where like this this, I would drink much more.

0,33l can at home shared by 3 from alesbymail. BB 30/05/2017. orange hazy color, small white head. smells of belgian yeast, some fruits, acidic, citric, some funk, light pines. nice smell. light to medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes citric, light pines, spices, some yeast, peppery, herbal, acidic, some green apples. finishes lightly bitter and peppery with notes of spices and citric notes. good one, quite belgian styley, a bit on the sour side. overall very nice lager.

Can share in Scopeys Lager Lounge. As Chorlton Comet Lager. Thanks to Kenny for these. Hazy orange, opaque, foamy beige head. Aroma is banana peel, chalky, a little floral, some vegetal stuff but not as much celery as the others. Body is smooth with tingly carbonation. Taste is chalky, floral, minerally, dry salty finish. Decent enough. (3.3)
can at home ... golden amber .. thin white lacing ... soft funky barn yard fruit nose ..tart funky fruit .. dry fruit .. light herbal fruit
Can shared with Stuu666. Pours hazy gold with a thin white head. Aromas of orange, herbal. Taste is more of the same. First one to have a slight lager bite to it

33cl can via Beer Gonzo. It pours a clean golden color with a medium white head. Aroma is fruity and grassy, light dry and grainy with notes of persimmon, grass, tangerine, apricots and lemon peel. Taste is medium fruity and hoppy, lightly sweet with a mildly dry butter grassy finish. Notes of apricots, persimmon, lemon peel and grass. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, very tasty

Can shared by Mart, thanks! Hazy golden amber pour, white head. Nose is malts, soft overripe melon, white grapes, citrus, tangerines. Flavor is pretty spicy, some notes akin to a spicy saison, peach. Resiny and dry finish, pine, fruit, citrus. Lingering resin and peach. Very flavorful.

Can (from beer gonzo). Pours golden with whiteish head. Aroma is mild, sweetness, some melon, and grapes. Flavor is sweet and bitter, fruits, apricot, tangerines, malt. Finish is sweet and dry apricot bitter. Overall: good.

Can. Archer Road Beer Stop, Sheffield. Hazy, orange gold. Frothy, foamy, lasting, off white head. Nice, sweet and spicy, orange rind hoppage. Some ripe nectarine. Hint of oily herb. Pale, crisp malt background. Taste has a little sweetness, followed by a floral, herby bitterness. Clean mouthfeel. Very crisp and sharp. Long, light bitter finish. Great stuff.

Grain and cereal malts, dough, citrus fruits, lemon rind, straw. Hazy, pale gold, medium, creamy, white head. Light bitter. Citrus fruits, grass, citrus fruits, lemon rind, grapefruit, light floral hops, medium carbonation. Decent Lager, very refreshing with nice taste. Can from HopLocker, Southbank.

16th June 2016Scopeys grand vertical. Can. Hazy gold beer, good pale cream colour head. Airy palate, decent fine carbonation. Light malts and light floral sweetness. Nice mild lemony hop, pinch of lemon sherbet to go with it. Light finish. Best of this bunch for me, Comet works very well here.

Bottle shared at Scopey place birthday tasting. Many thanks to Kenny for this one. Translucent yellow straw coloured pour with a lasting thin white head. Aroma grassy citrus, weed, straw, hints of tropical fruits. Flavour is composed of spicy grassy citrus the, straw, pineapple. Palate is medium bodied, moderate carbonation, semi sweet sticky.

Can shared in East Croydon - thanks to Kenworth. Pours unclear gold with a creamy, white head. Lovely snout, with notes of melon, peach, pale bread. Light sweet flavor, with hints of white grape, more melon, tangerine, peach. Light bodied with fine to verge carbonation. Juicy and citrusy on the finish, with more tangerine, peach. Really smashable.

Can at Mother Kellys. It pours cloudy orange with a medium white head. The aroma is fresh, grassy, dank weed, bread, muffin and grass. The taste is smooth, earthy, grass, green hops, dank, weed, pithy grapefruit, touch of alcohol, creaminess and spice with a dry finish. Medium body and fine, foamy carbonation. Rather nice lagebier. Look forward to trying out the rest of this series.
